text: Hey, girl, I know you hear me.
What?
Easy, baby.
I'm just a squirrel trying to get a nut.
Except I'm a koala.

♪ He looked like a slob ♪

♪ An opportunity ♪

It was scary, y'all.

♪ Reginald ♪

he's cute as a button ♪♪
Anyways, maybe sometimes I'll be on missions and sometimes I'll just be here at the house.

But my number one duty is to say 
Howdy Doody to your fruity.
♪ Cute as a button ♪♪
So we're at the restaurant, and Ian plucks a hair out of my head and puts it in the spaghetti to try
to get us a free meal.
You know what the problem is?
You're dating a boy.
What you need to be doing is dating a grown-ass man.
Well, it's late.
I better head home.
Good night, Hayley.
Good night, Reggie.
I had a great time tonight.
Whoa, girl, that's the cognac talking.
I'm all up in your head right now.
You're a little bit excited.
You saw Reggie get a little loose today.
I know what I'm doing.
Hayley, I'm seeing someone.
Oh, you never mentioned that.

Well, I didn't think it was relevant. 
We were hanging out as friends.
Look, do I know if it's gonna work out with my lady friend?
No, I don't, but I have to respect Rhonda.
If I didn't, I'd be just like those boys you run around with down at the schoolyard.
Wow, that's really honorable.
She's a lucky lady.
But I want you to know two things.
I sleep with my door unlocked, and this just happened.
Woo, she got the drop on
Old Reggie. Caught those full in the face.
Those were guns, Reggie be dead.
Oh!

Hey, Reggie. 
- What a
beautiful vase.
It's a menses pot.
Oh, okay. That's cool.

Hey, our date the other night got a bit
overpopulated.
What do you say we try that again?
Just us.
Sorry, Reggie. It's just--
Oh, seeing Jeff brought up a lot of old feelings.
Oh. Mm, hmm
I need some time alone to sort things out.
Ah, yeah. You take as much time as you-- No!
You know what? I'm done pretending. I love you,
Hayley. I always have.
Reggie...I had no idea.
No you didn't.
Now I'm gonna give you some time to listen to your heart.
But--
♪ Little girl at the pottery wheel, take your time ♪
♪ Figure out how you feel ♪
♪ And when you're ready to be mine ♪
♪ You'll be ready for koala-ty time ♪♪
Whoa! You got a limo?
Are you rich?
Yeah, Jeff. I'm rich.
I'm a millionaire.
So I wear this stupid hat and drive this long, bitch.
Hayley won't talk to me.
I've tried everything.
Look, man, Hayley broke my heart, too.
But the girl told us both she needs some space.
You should do what I'm doing.
Start casually dating other women.
I'm seeing a fine bitch right now who works at Chick- Fil-A down by the airport.
Got grease burns all over her arms.
Am I gonna marry her? Hell, no.
But she don't need to know that.
Um. All right, I guess I could give Hayley her space.
My man. Now go take a shower.
You smell like cheap weed and apple sauce.
Cheap weed and apple sauce.
Reginald, are we at the CIA yet?
Change of
plans. I'm going after the woman of my dreams.
Hayley Smith.
Hayley Smith?
Oh, I had a thing with her one summer.
What?
You and Hayley had a thing?
A thing? That's a polite way of saying
I tapped her like a pony keg.
Banged her around so much, I lost my deposit.
Sir, I would appreciate it if you could refrain from any sexual
reminiscing regarding Hayley whilst we take our little detour.

Ah, I took a detour on Hayley. 
Got lost in the brush and went down a dirt road.
What's all this now?
Why are we stopping?
You and I are gonna fight in the field.

What are you doing?
Capoeira, bitch!
It's Brazilian dance fighting.
I'm trained. Ah!
Oh, I guess we started.
Ah! My gentleman's blouse!
Yaaagh!!!
And I know I've got matches in here somewhere.
Phone. Brick.
What up, Franny?
